Description: Papyrus fragment of a loan agreement mentioning an amount of wine: 14 lines of Coptic text and the top and left margins are partially preserved on one side, written against the fibres (verso). Lacunae in parts of ll. 2-3 and 11-12. EA 75320, 75319, 75318, 75317, 75316, 75315 are mounted together.
Curator's comments: Provenance: the place of origin was most probably the Hermopolite monastery of Apa Apollo if the introductory formula 'anok pason NN eishai' (i.e. 'I, brother NN, am writing') is correctly reconstructed. Support for the Hermopolite origin of this manuscript may also be provided by a formula used in the text. The interpretation of this text as a loan agreement rests largely upon the conjecture that a section of l. 5 is part of the standard loan agreement formula involving the phrase 'I owe you' and followed by the phrase which marks the beginning of the clause promising (re)payment. To judge from l. 10, a repayment of more than one solidus was to be made: following, a number greater than or equal to two is expected.
Bibliographic references: Clackson 2000 / Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo (p.12, 112-3, pl.30)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (86597) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/86597)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Monastery of Apa Apollo
